# Arpeggio: Minor 7th in A (Shape: D)

### Brief Presentation
An arpeggio is the playing of the notes of a chord in a sequential manner, typically ascending or descending. The Minor 7th arpeggio in A, using the "D shape" on the guitar, comprises the notes A, C, E, and G. This combination produces a distinct sound commonly used in various musical genres.

### Breakdown of Notes and Intervals
- A (Root)
- C (Minor 3rd)
- E (Perfect 5th)
- G (Minor 7th)

### Musical Flavor and Genre
The Minor 7th Arpeggio in A provides a smooth and jazzy sound due to the inclusion of the Minor 3rd and Minor 7th intervals. It is often used in jazz, R&B, soul, and blues music to add flavor and depth to chord progressions, solos, and improvisations.
